intro: Seseli kochii, commonly known as the mountain sesame, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Russia. The plant features slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Seseli kochii is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
